Title: Losing Optimism As You Get Older (Charlie, Linnea, Amy)

We notice that 15-24 year olds are more optimistic that the world is getting better and the 40 year olds are seeing the opposite. Indonesia has the highest population out of all the countries. Brazil and Mali are the lowest in each category. We wonder what makes younger people think more postively about the world and why the older generation thinks so negatively. Also, we wonder what the older people see as the negatives about the world and what the youngers see so postive. The impact we think affects us is because we, ourselves, are apart of the 15-24 year olds.
ace_sentences: The title is: Losing Optimism As You Get Older (Charlie, Linnea, Amy).
We notice that people who are 15-24 years old are more optimistic.
We notice that people who are 40 years old are less optimistic.
Indonesia has the highest population among all countries.
Brazil is the lowest in one category.
Mali is the lowest in another category.
We wonder what makes younger people think more positively about the world.
We wonder why the older generation thinks negatively about the world.
We wonder what older people see as negative about the world.
We wonder what younger people see as positive about the world.
We are part of the group of people who are 15-24 years old.
We think that this fact affects us.
